bdsreader 0.6.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Reads selected BDS data of a person

Source: R/read_bds.R
read_bds.Rd

This function takes data from a json source, validates the contents against a JSON validation schema, perform checks, calculates the D-score, calculates Z-scores and transforms the data as a tibble with a person attribute.

read_bds(
  txt = NULL,
  schema = "bds_schema.json",
  append_ddi = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

txt

A JSON string, URL or file
schema

A JSON string, URL or file that selects the JSON validation schema. The default corresponds to schema = bds_schema.json and loads inst/json/bds_schema.json. The older schema = bds_schema_str.json expects that numeric BDS values are specified as characters.
append_ddi

Should DDI measures be appended?
verbose

Show verbose output for centile::y2z()
...

Pass down to jsonlite::fromJSON()

Value

A tibble with 8 columns with a person attribute

See also

jsonlite::fromJSON(), centile::y2z()

Author

Stef van Buuren 2021

Examples

fn <- system.file("examples", "Laura_S2.json", package = "bdsreader")
q <- read_bds(fn)
q
